intro: Rhaphidorhynchus galeandrae, commonly known as the Galena orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring intricate sepals and petals that are often adorned with distinctive markings. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its flowering period occurs during the late spring to early summer, producing delicate, fragrant blooms. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
